Text.Value: That deserves to be remembered.
Skilled as I'm sure you are, I don't need my exploits put to song.
Shut it. The last thing I want is some sappy song about me.
How about courage? Classic song material.
Sing of my battle spirit, and how it mirrors that of the ferocious and beloved Queen Vlaakith.
Your song was coming along. Then things began spinning... worry not, I shall return to it at first light!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Holding her hand out - as if to steady herself.

Text.Value: This might be the wine talking, but I'm feeling inspired. Thinking of writing my next song - about you.
After Elturel, I think you're right. Faer√ªn deserves to see us as we really are.
I don't deserve such praise. I serve a higher power.
With a name like that, the song practically writes itself!
Erm, all right - it's your song. Now what rhymes with 'dirty elf'...
You tried the wine? My teacher never let me have any. I must say, it is delicious.
But of course. You achieved something far beyond mere fact.
Hah. As usual, getting ahead of myself. Enjoy your night, then!
'By the Weave, and light-filled touch...' You're going to love it!
Oh... sure. Of course. Have a nice night.
Oh! That's very... visceral. I might tone it down a touch, but I'll keep the intent.
Honestly? I'd rather you didn't.
Pfft. The gods have enough people singing about them. But fine - I'll do my best!
Sing about my prowess in battle.
How about the goblin spines I'd ripped out with my bare hands?
Fitting. Seeing you fight makes us, makes me, feel like I'm capable of anything.
Don't worry: I'm not secretly composing something for you - simply enjoying my evening.
If I want a song about me, I'll write it myself.
Not really. I'm not much of a bard.
But I need an angle. Any ideas?
Heh. Lakrissa would approve.
I still have no idea what to do in Baldur's Gate. Bah. That's tomorrow's problem.
But if she's as ferocious as you, she must be quite impressive. I'll do my best!
Humble heroes make the best ballads. But fair - I'll not force you. Enjoy your night!
Absolutely! 'With a foot in two worlds, you're the force joining both... ' You're going to love it.
Let it be only as truthful as true poetry would permit.
If I hear my name in a song, your life is forfeit.
I'm not familiar with this Vlaakith, I'm afraid.
Fine, grumpypants. Serves me right for trying to be nice.
Just mention the legend that is the Blade of Frontiers, the hardiest hero to ever travel the Sword Coast.
Have you seen this body? It would be a crime not to sing about it.
Fitting. You're braver than half this camp combined. That deserves to be remembered.
Maybe a song about my mixed heritage? It's a point of pride for me.
'A smile that sets the heart aglow...' You're going to love it!
Oh, come on. There must be something!
I couldn't agree more.
This might be the wine talking, but I'm feeling inspired. I want to get a start on your song.
Make it a song for everyone who fought. Couldn't have done it alone.
Sing about surface elves - and how filthy and pathetic they are.
Sing about our people. We deserve it.
Of course. I guess it was a silly idea. Have a nice night.
There's just so much. Let's start with my physical beauty and go from there.
I'd rather hear a song about Mystra.
I don't know any ballads about her. But I can write one for you!
One raunchy ballad, coming up!

Synopsis: Alfira the tiefling bard is standing not far away from the campfire, enjoying the festivities.
